newsitem.title: UK: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.
newsitem.headline: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.

text.p: A total 43,500 tonnes of current series white sugar received export rebates of a maximum 44.180 European Currency Units (Ecus) per 100 kilos at Wednesday's European Union (EU) tender, the U.K. Intervention Board said.
Out of this, traders in France received 26,500 tonnes and in the U.K. 17,000 tonnes, it added.

This week's award brings the cumulative tonnage awarded for export from the 1996/97 crop to 1.680 million tonnes. This compares with the 75,250 tonnes awarded on March 20, 1996, when the cumulative tonnage totalled 1.722 million tonnes.
Earlier on Wednesday, London traders had expected the subsidy for the current season whites campaign for licences to end-August to be 44.166 Ecus per 100 kilos.
Traders had also forecast the total authorised sugar tonnage export awards to be up to 30,000 tonnes versus 38,550 last week when the restitution was 43.862 Ecus.
